item.dc:creator: @fuzzout fuzzout
item.description:
@fuzzout wrote:

Hello,
This is my first tutorial in a very long time, I thought I’d code something incredibly simple but awfully useful!

	public boolean isWithin(int x, int y, int range)  //int x and y are for the coordinates, range is the radius...
	{
	if ((absX >= x - range && absX <= x + range) && (absY >= y - range && absY <= y + range)) { //this is the general checking
	return true;//if the player is actually there, return true
	} else {
	return false; //the player is not there! OMG!
	}
	}

Now, the magic use for it could be for example, a spell where a certain area deals damage, if the player approaches it… or to check whether the player is within range of a certain object (i know there’s a similar code for that, but this one is more general)…

An example of how I used it:

if (!isWithin(2464, 4782, 4)) {
             sendMessage("You didn't get back to Lich King in time, the earth swallows you whole!");
	hitDiff = currentHealth;
	dealDamage(hitDiff);
	hitDiff = hitDiff;
	updateRequired = true;
	hitUpdateRequired = true;
}

Since I don’t want to spoil all the coding fun of it, I’ll leave the declaration of it, up to you
